questions.question_text: A hafiz or hafiza  is someone who has completely memorised which major religious text ?

The International Criminal Court (ICC) is an intergovernmental organization and international tribunal seated in The Hague, Netherlands. It was established in 2002 following a multilateral "statute" adopted at, and named after, a diplomatic conference held  in what European capital city , on 17 July 1998?

Among many examples of the literary archetype known as the "superfluous man"  is the Byron -like figure , Pechorin , the protagonist of what 1840  Russian  novel ? Though he claims to "despise women to avoid loving them", he appears to legitimately care for an old lover , Vera.

translations.mandarin: dāngdài yīngxióng  Norwegian: Vår tids helt

questions.question_text: Which river  joins the Indus at the point at which the Hindu Kush, the Himalayas, and the Karakoram all meet? A namesake city on this river gives its name to a region that, itself, co -names  an administrative territory of northern Kashmir, administered by Pakistan but subject to a dispute with India.

What word , originally coined by Auguste Comte to mean the opposite of 'egoism', is used in biology to refer to any behaviour that increases the fitness of another at the expense of decreasing one’s own fitness? Kin selection and reciprocity are mechanisms by which this behaviour can evolve.

The headstrong Pinky is the sister of the protagonist, Sampath, in which Indian author 's 1998 novel Hullabaloo in the Guava Orchard ? This woman's only other novel is the acclaimed 2006 book The Inheritance of Loss .
accept: ‘Desai’ alone but do not accept her mother

questions.question_text: What colour  is the rider (‘Reiter’ in the original German) in the title of a famous painting by Wassily Kandinsky that gives its name to a wider art movement associated with Franz Marc and August Macke?

Home to the brands Pol Roger and Perrier -Jouet, the French town of Épernay  is considered the centre of the industry making which product , named after the former province in northeastern France to which Épernay belonged between 1314 and 1790?
Which American Marxist feminist philosopher  wrote the 1981 book Women, Race and Class  that analyses US history between the abolitionist movement and the women's liberation movement?

What word , the name given to the currency of  several nations, derives from a large silver coin first minted in Bohemia in around 1520 , and subsequently used across the Holy Roman Empire and parts of the Habsburg holdings?

The occurrence of constructive interference when the path difference between scattered X -rays is equal to an integer multiple of the wavelength is an expression of which eponymous law  underpinning X -ray crystallography, formulated by a father and son who shared the 1915 Nobel Prize in Physics?

translations.mandarin: bùlāgé  dìnglǜ The word for ‘law ’ differs from language

questions.question_text: Known for its extreme placidity, which has seen the species achieve  internet celebrity, which semi -aquatic South American mammal  is the world's largest rodent?

translations.mandarin: shuǐ tún Norwegian: flodsvin  or kapivar  or

questions.question_text: What name  – from Afrikaans – is given to the system of legalised racial segregation that was enforced in South Africa from 1948 to 1994?

This major Punjabi river  was assigned to India by the historic Indus Water Treaty of 1960 and the Rajasthan Canal project diverted its waters into previously unirrigated areas of India. Which river  that runs along the border between Pakistan and India in Punjab is home to the manmade Ropar wetland?

Although, contrary to popular myth, he did not discover the Champagne method, this French Benedictine monk did make important improvements to the quality of sparkling wine production. This is which man , who died in 1715 ?

The 'Paganini' section of which composer 's 1835 piano piece Carnaval  contains an early example of extended piano technique when the performer silently depresses a chord related to the overtone series of previous chords, and then depresses the sustain pedal to produ ce the sound of sympathetically vibrating strings? Chopin described Carnaval as 'not real music at all' but is the dedicatee of another of this composer's solo piano pieces, Kreisleriana .
What name  is used for the 114 chapters that make up the Quran? These chapters may be further divided into verses or ayat .

One PhD student of Sir William Henry Bragg was which Irish X -ray crystallographer who was the first to demonstrate the planar hexagonal structure of the benzene ring using X -ray diffraction methods on hexamethylbenzene? She was one of the first two women, alongside biochemist Margory Stephenson, to be elected a fellow of the Royal Soci ety and she gives her name to a particularly hard allotrope of carbon – also known as hexagonal diamond – that is found only in meteorite debris .
Hakodate Park, Ohori Park in Fukuoka, and Tsuruma Park in Nagoya are among ten parks registered as "places of scenic beauty" in what country ?

What unit of currency , used in ancient Mesopotamia, originally denoted a small unit of weight of around 11 grams? The same name is shared by a currency that was adopted by a UN member state in 1980, when it replaced the previous currency, known as the pound.

What EU country  announced its withdrawal from the ICC in April 2025, in conjunction with a visit from the Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, who is currently sought under an ICC arrest warrant? Unless retracted, the withdrawal will become effective in April 2026, coinciding with the country's parliamentary elections.
An earlier "superfluous man" is the title character of  what 1859 Russian novel  who spends almost the entire novel doing nothing except talking to visiting friends or his servant, Sachar?

translations.german: Oblomow  Mandarin: ào bó luò mò fū

questions.question_text: Which biologist  gives his name to a 'rule' that explains how kin selection can lead to altruistic behaviour, in which rB > C  [r b is greater than C] where  r is the coefficient of relatedness, B is the benefit of an altruistic act to the recipient , and C is the cost of the act to the performer? It can be summarised by a joke made by J. B. S. Haldane which states that he would willingly die for at least two of his brothers or at least eight of his cousins.
The daughter of TimTam, Pinky befriends Ness at Thomas Allan Stockham's plantation in which acclaimed 2016 novel  by the Ghanaian -American author Yaa Gyasi?

translations.german: Heimkehren  Mandarin: guī qù lái xī

questions.question_text: What was the name  of the first silver coin struck by the Roman Empire? The word for "money" in a number of Romance languages ultimately derives from the name of this coin, valued at 10 assēs .

translations.mandarin: dì nà lǐ wūsī  Polish: denar

questions.question_text: George Crumb's Makrokosmos  is an avant -garde work that includes extended piano techniques such as plucking the strings, using objec ts like  plectrums and thimbles, and whistling. Makrokosmos was a response to which European composer 's Mikrokozmosz (Mikrokosmos) , a collection of 153 piano pieces, written between 1926 and 1939, some of which use extended techniques such as silent pressing ?
The painting known in English as The Old Guitarist , painted in 1903 and 1904, was part of the Período Azul (Blue Period) of what famed artist ?
Angela Davis studied at the university in which European city  where Max Horkheimer led the Institut für Sozialforschung (Institute for Social Research)?

translations.french: Francfort  Mandarin: měi yīn hépàn fǎlánkèfú

questions.question_text: Which world famous anti -apartheid freedom fighter  and future President shared the 1993 Nobel Peace prize with South African president F. W. De Klerk?

Superfluous man and noble Dmitrii Nikolevich Rudin is the central figure of Rudin , the first full-length novel published by what author ? This author had written one of the earliest depictions of a superfluous man six years earlier, in a novella centring on the terminally  ill Tchulkaturin.

What term , meaning 'in the name of God', is repeated before each surah  except the ninth, At -Tawbah? Tasmiyah  refers to the act of saying this term , which is also recited before certain religious practices and daily activities.

Kin selection explains the co -operative behaviour of eusocial insects. Insects in the order Hymenoptera (bees, wasps, ants) use which sex -determination system  in which males hatch from unfertilised eggs containing only genetic information from their mother, and females hatch from fertilised eggs, containing genetic information from both parents? This means that the workers in a colony are more closely related t o their sisters than to their own offspring.

Despite their size, adult capybaras still have plenty of predators. One such predator is which mammal , the largest cat species in the Americas? It shares much of its range with another predator of the capybara, the cougar or puma, from which it can be distinguished by its larger size and the rosettes on its fur.

Madame de Pompadour was among the best customers of which French wine merchant , who served the royal court at Versailles during the 1730s and who became the first winemaker in Champagne to exclusively produce sparkling wine? Best known for its  Dom Pérignon label, t he Champagne house he created  is now owned by LVMH and his surname provides one of the letters in the name of that company.

Park Güell is a privatized complex of parks, gardens, and architectural elements in the Gràcia district of which Spanish city ? It was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1984, in part because of the works of Antonio Gaud í located within.

In 2005, the ICC issued its first arrest warrants. These targeted Joseph Kony, Vincent Otti, and three other leaders of the Lord's Resistance Army, a Christian extremist organization founded to work  against President Yoweri Museveni  and towards the establishment of a Christian state in what African country ?

Another Irish protege of William Henry Bragg was which biochemist and polymath nicknamed "Sage", also important for his logistics work on the WW2 Operation Overlord? His scientific work with his PhD student, Dorothy Hodgkin, on the X -ray diffraction of wet crystals of pepsin, demonstrating an ordered X -ray diffraction pattern, laid the foundations of modern protein crystallography.
Pinky Madam, an Americanized Indian woman who evades the law after killing a child in a hit -and-run accident, is a major character in which best -selling 2008 novel  by Aravind Adiga?

One of the largest and most visited urban parks in the world, the Bosque de Chapultepec is found in the Manuel Hidalgo borough in what major capital city ? The park is home to Los Pinos, which was the official presidential residence and office between 1934 and 2018 .

In November 2024, the ICC issued an arrest warrant for which former head  of the Palestinian Izz al -Din al -Qassam Brigades five months after he was presumed assassinated in an Israeli airstrike? The warrant was cancelled in February 2025, after his death had been confirmed.
Kraak ware is white porcelain decorated with blue designs that was produced during the final years of which Chinese dynasty , which ruled from 1368 until 1644?
Another predator of capybaras is which relatively small crocodilian  of the family Alligatoridae, found in the swamps, lakes, and mangrove rivers of South and Central America?

Opened in 1967 to strengthen the country’s irrigation system, the Mangla Dam was constructed by Pakistan in Pakistani -controlled Kashmir on which river , the westernmost of the five major rivers of the Punjab region?
questions.answer: Jhelum  (accept Hydaspes , Bidaspes , Vitastā , Bihat , Vehat , Bihatab , Biyatta ,

translations.mandarin: jié hèlè m ǔ hé Polish: Dźhelam

questions.question_text: Many works centring on superfluous men, including Rudin , were published in what Russian literary magazine ? Both Ivan Turgenev and Ivan Goncharov were hired to work on this magazine by its editor, Nikolay Nekrasov.
Which weather -related phenomenon  precedes 'nation' in a name  popularised by Desmond Tutu  to describe post -apartheid South Africa?
Angela Davis's doctoral advisor at the University of Frankfurt was which German -born philosopher  who wrote the English -language works Eros and Civilization  and One - Dimensional Man ?

What is the name  for the canonical reports of the sayings and the deeds of the Prophet Muhammad? These texts are widely considered the second most important source for Islamic norms and guidance, or Sunnah , after the Quran.

In his piece Szabadban (Out of Doors) , Bartók used 'tone clusters', chords containing at least three adjacent tones, typically played by depressing keys with the flat of the hand or the forearm. Which American composer  instructs the performer to use a 14¾ inch - long wooden strip to play tone clusters in 'Hawthorne', the second movement of his Piano Sonata No. 2, known as the Concord Sonata ?

In a 1967 paper, W. D. Hamilton coined the term ‘unbeatable strategy’ while describing the effectiveness of 1:1 sex -ratios. John Maynard Smith mathematically formalised the idea of an unbeatable strategy into what concept , which refers a phenotype that, once in place, cannot be replaced or invaded by any other phenotype?

translations.mandarin: jìnhuà wěndìng duìcè  Norwegian:  evolusjonært stabil strategi

questions.question_text: Between 1967 and 1968, Angela Davis attended a series of seminars given at Frankfurt by which German philosopher  to discuss his book Negative Dialektik (Negative Dialectics) ? This man's other works include Dialektik der Aufklärung (Dialectic of Enlightenment) , which he co -wrote with Max Horkheimer.
Another predator of adult capybaras is which semi -aquatic South American snake  of the genus Eunectes , particularly its 'green' species, which is the world's heaviest snake?
questions.answer: anaconda  (accept water boa  but prompt on ‘boa’  and do not accept ‘boa

translations.mandarin: shuǐ rán shǔ or sēnrán  Swedish: anakondor

questions.question_text: The Tathagata Tsal, situated near Ravangla in South Sikkim, India, is more commonly known as [BLANK] Park with the blank filled by which religious figure ? The park’s centrepiece  is a 40-metre -tall statue of this figure, erected to mark the 2550th anniversary of his birth.

The first vintage Champagne was created in 1810 by which Frenchwoman , who took on her husband's wine business when she was widowed in 1805 at the age of 27? Also the inventor of the first known blended rosé Champagne, she gives her name to the prestigious Champagne house that she created.

What coin , minted almost entirely from gold, was used widely across medieval Europe for trade purposes after being introduced in Venice in 1284? The coin's name derives from one of the noble titles held by Roger II of Sicily, who had introduced a similar coin the p revious century.

Inspired by his discussions with John Bernal during a posting to Southeast Asia during WW2, which biochemist and crystallographer  worked closely with one of Lawrence Bragg's PhD students, Max Perutz, sharing a 1962 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their X - ray crystallographically determined structures of the oxygen carrying macromolecules haemoglobin and myoglobin?
The 17 -year -old sociopath Pinkie Brown is the central character in which 1938 English novel ?

One of Charles Ives’ biggest supporters was Henry Cowell, who used many extended techniques and is credited with inspiring which other American composer  to develop the 'prepared piano', which involves putting different objects along the piano strings before performing? Pieces this composer wrote for the prepared piano include Bacchanale  and Totem Ancestor .
Nelson Mandela spent 18 of his 27 years of imprisonment on which island prison located just off the coast of  Cape Town?

Which semi -precious stone  was ground into a fine powder to produce the bright blue pigment ultramarine, which was extensively used by artists until a synthetic alternative was invented in the 19th century?

The Baglihar Dam , which has been operational since  2008 , lies on which Punjabi  river that  flows through Indian -held Kashmir before reaching Pakistan? Pakistan has objected to the dam claiming it violates the 1960 Indus Water Treaty.
Created in 1893, Skrik  (The Scream) is the masterpiece of which Norwegian painter ?
Henri Moissan was awarded the Nobel Prize for Chemistry in 1906 for his work in isolating which yellowish -brown gaseous element  from its compounds?
Premiering in Prague in 1921, which science -fiction play  by the Czech author Karel Čapek is best remembered today for having introduced and popularized the word ‘robot’?
In 2004, Indulis Emsis became the first head of government  to represent a Green party when he was elected Prime Minister of which country ?
Located off Tunisia’s Gulf of Gabès  and supposedly Odysseus’ s island  of the Lotus - Eaters, what is the name of the largest island  off the North African coast?
Many Inca villages would keep an oddly  shaped example of which foodstuff  in order to worship the deity Axomamma, who is the Incan goddess of that  foodstuff?
